intro: Aegiphila killipii, commonly known as Killip's aegiphila, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western Mexico. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant features small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, arranged in dense clusters at the ends of its branches. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a hairy texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Aegiphila killipii is considered a species of conservation concern.
